report_title: Industry Report on Online Tutoring Services
executive_summary: Online tutoring services boomed through the COVID-19 pandemic as they became the sole option for students looking for help with their coursework. Accordingly, the growing industry saw its strongest revenue growth on record in 2020. Many schools, unable to meet student needs amid teacher layoffs, are leaning heavily on online tutors to help struggling students. Revenue has been surging at a CAGR of 6.9% to an estimated $1.8 billion over the five years through 2024. Revenue will expand by 3.6% in 2024 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Tutors Stepped In Through The Pandemic And Have Remained Integral To Education
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The COVID-19 pandemic forced many schools to embrace online learning in 2020. Most schools continued online learning to mitigate outbreaks in 2021. Online tutors became the only option for students seeking help with their schoolwork. Teachers experienced layoffs and quit in some cases after 2020. Many schools couldn't rehire new teachers to fill in-person positions and meet student needs, leading to rising student-to-teacher ratios that made it difficult for students to get one-on-one help. Online tutors stepped in to address unmet demand for academic assistance.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Students Are Struggling, Driving Demand for Tutors
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The National Assessment of Educational Progress (NAEP), often called the Nation's Report Card, measures mathematics and reading skills among 9- and 13-year-olds. The latest study reported a drop in math scores for both demographics from 2019 to 2022, the first ever for 9-year-olds. Reading skills also fell over the same period, indicating pandemic-era struggles that weighed on children's ability to learn effectively. Lower-performing students aren't alone in driving the drops in scores. Students across the board are scoring worse on exams, which translates to a larger base of potential students for online tutors to help achieve higher marks.

Educators have embraced high-dose tutoring to address pandemic-era declines in student performance. Under the high-dose method, students meet with tutors one-on-one or in small groups multiple times a week. High-dose tutoring is especially labor-intensive for online providers but fosters a better connection between tutor and student, which can lead to better academic outcomes. The growing popularity of premium high-dose tutoring services helped online tutors generate significant revenue growth through the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Profit is Dropping as Online Tutoring Careens Toward Market Saturation
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Highly publicized declines in test scores have pushed many concerned educators away from online tutoring toward high-dose in-person instruction, which is often thought to be more effective. Educated individuals working from home have found a convenient opportunity to make extra money by offering tutoring services online. Online tutors don't necessarily need teaching or tutoring experience to find clients, making it a popular "side hustle" for many with a strong academic or professional background. Easy barriers to entry and high demand have made room for a massive influx of new online tutors. Growth in the number of online tutoring services has significantly outpaced revenue growth as new competition forces tutors to offer lower rates. Downward pressure on prices has translated to profit compression for online tutoring services.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Fewer Students Are Pursuing Help With Standardized Tests
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Changing college admission policies have reduced demand for online tutoring services. Ballooning student debt has made many skeptical of college's return on investment, leading to declining enrollment. Smaller classes have sped up a long-term trend of dropping standardized test score requirements. The Supreme Court's decision ending affirmative action and the COVID-19 pandemic pushed colleges away from required test scores even more. Now, over 80.0% of the nation's universities don't require SAT or ACT scores. Disappearing testing requirements translate to lessened demand for help studying for exams. Online tutors generate over a quarter of their revenue through exam preparation courses, so these changes have muted revenue growth.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Tutors and Teachers Will Integrate to Improve Student-to-Teacher Ratios
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: A Polk County, Florida pilot program will test how students perform with tutors serving as "co-teachers." Curriculums will feature more tutor-teacher integration to develop customized, one-on-one student instruction. Online tutoring can put ten teachers in a classroom instead of one. Integrated curricula also ensure tutors don't stray too far from the core curriculum. Tutors will become more familiar with a specific student's curriculum and won't teach any misleading information or outdated methods. More familiarity will tremendously enhance online tutors' quality by reducing the transaction cost of tutors trying to figure out what students have been taught.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Bots Compete With and Complement Online Tutors
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Artificial intelligence bots are beginning to transform the traditional role of tutors, creating a more personalized learning environment. Rather than replacing human educators, AI tools are providing them with valuable resources to enhance their teaching tactics. Bots may compete with tutors, but they can also complement tutoring services. Tutors can leverage the power of bots by feeding the computer past homework, textbook chapters and previous lessons, which the bot can then use to develop lesson plans and quizzes based on the student's curriculum and particular needs.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Profit Will Continue Sinking as Competition Ramps Up
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Beginning work as an online tutor will only become easier moving forward. Manageable barriers to entry will make online tutoring attractive as a career, pushing the industry toward market saturation. As schools embrace online tutoring services, some tutoring will be free for parents and students and paid for by the district. School systems can fund the low cost of online tutoring by buying in bulk and securing discounts, giving tutors access to coveted contracts and a reliable revenue stream. Students will have access to more online tutoring services than ever, giving them more power over the industry. Price will become a more critical competitive base, leading to declining hourly rates. Combined with rising wages, online tutors will contend with dropping profit.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Falling Birth Rates Threaten Online Tutoring Services in the Long Term
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Most of online tutoring services' revenue comes from tutoring primary school students. As parents choose to have fewer or no children, the base of potential elementary student clients for online tutors shrinks. Online tutoring services may need to adapt their marketing and service offerings to target non-traditional student demographics, like adult learners or students in different geographic regions.

industry_definition: This industry provides tutoring services via the Internet. Online tutoring services provide academic assistance across a variety of academic subjects and all age groups for children in primary and secondary school as well as college students.

opportunities: High Performance Drivers - Percentage of business conducted online

key_trends: A rush of online tutors entered the market in the wake of COVID-19.
Profit has taken a hit as competition ramps up.
New online tutors separate themselves by building a reputation or specializing. Tutors can quickly leverage their profession or academic success to build a solid reputation.

Schools want to integrate teachers and tutors into the curriculum to support students. Most working parents welcome school-backed extra help, and some kick in extra funding to prepare children for college admission.
Mounting competition is cutting into profit.
The growing industry is sliding toward market saturation as new online tutors begin offering services, leading to dampened hourly rates.
Chegg drives expansion through clever advertising on platforms frequented by students.
Schools in Polk County, Florida, tapped into ESSER II funding to hire online tutors.
These tutors complement teachers struggling under the weight of staffing shortages.
The No Child Left Behind Act of 2001 provides funding for after-school tutoring and, sometimes, resources to access the internet outside of school.
The Act helps connect students to online tutors and ensures consistent revenue through government grants.
Profit is sinking amid intense competition.
Technological improvements are streamlining tutoring and keeping costs manageable. High demand is keeping revenue on the rise, buoying profit.

Employing online tutoring companies didn't contend with a significant wage spike after 2020. The many online tutors looking for a side hustle ensured a vast supply of potential employees, keeping costs low.
Location doesn't matter for online tutors.
Online tutors in California can quickly call in to meet with students on the East Coast.
Some online tutors run hybrid tutoring models combining online and in-person. Tutors may meet in person to cover a complex topic or give hands-on support leading up to an important test.
Online tutoring provides much-needed flexibility for busy students and parents. Many students, particularly in high school, balance school with sports, theater or jobs.

High schoolers invest heavily in online tutoring to prepare for college admission examinations. Still, standardized test requirements are disappearing. Over 80.0% of universities don't require SAT or ACT scores, making exam prep courses less popular than before.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Younger students faced significant interruptions when schools transitioned to online learning in 2020. Many require online tutors to keep up, even in 2023. Most K-8 students use online tutors to help them grasp complex concepts and avoid falling behind.

Younger students faced significant interruptions when schools transitioned to online learning in 2020. Many require online tutors to keep up, even in 2023. Most K-8 students use online tutors to help them grasp complex concepts and avoid falling behind.
High school students may prefer online tutoring because of the flexibility offered. Students bogged down by school, sports and jobs want easy access to tutors.
Professionals and postsecondary students use online tutoring services to obtain certification for specific trades or to prepare for graduate school exams.

products_and_services.product_description: Online tutors help elementary, middle and high school students with history, literature, social studies, science, math and many other subjects. Younger students receive extra help if falling behind or additional instruction to help them get ahead.

products_and_services.product_or_service: PRIMARY SCHOOL TUTORING PROGRAMS AND COURSES
products_and_services.product_description: According to the US Census Bureau, nearly 93.0% of households reported that their children spent some time learning online throughout COVID-19. Some thrived, but others struggled to focus and keep up.

products_and_services.product_or_service: OCCUPATIONAL AND ADVANCED ACADEMIC PROGRAMS AND COURSES
products_and_services.product_description: Online tutors work with professionals entering occupations and advanced programs that require particular certifications. These include trade occupations like engineers, mechanics and technicians.

demand_determinants.determinant_description: The number of K-12 students represents the total enrollment in public and private kindergarten, elementary and secondary schools. An increase in the number of students gives online tutors a larger pool of students to help through tutoring. Stagnation in the number of K-12 students poses a potential threat to online tutors.

business_locations.location_description: Online tutors gravitate toward the nation's largest markets, including the West, Mid-Atlantic and Southeast. These regions have the most students and potential clients. Operating in a populous area makes finding qualified tutors much easier.

Online tutors gravitate toward the nation's largest markets, including the West, Mid-Atlantic and Southeast. These regions have the most students and potential clients. Operating in a populous area makes finding qualified tutors much easier.

The Mid-Atlantic and West also house some of the country's top high schools and universities. Online tutors can affiliate themselves with highly regarded areas to improve branding, especially when marketing to clients in other states.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Professional certifications are available through the National Tutoring Association and the American Tutoring Association. Advanced certifications cover academic materials as well as strategies like diversity training, education methods and techniques for dealing with students and parents from disadvantaged backgrounds.

regulations_points.regulation_title: No Child Left Behind Act of 2001
regulations_points.regulation_description: The No Child Left Behind (NCLB) Act of 2001 mandates that schools failing to meet federal standards must provide free afterschool tutoring to low-income students.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Some online tutors earn accreditation to certify their skills and trustworthiness, but legal costs don't weigh down online tutoring services.
Computers, educational materials and video conferencing services comprise the highest start-up costs.
Reputation and specialization help new online tutors differentiate themselves.
Online tutoring services looking to hire tutors can rely on tutoring session income to cover employee expenses.

basis_points.basis_description: A rush of online tutors entered the market in the wake of COVID-19. Profit has taken a hit as competition ramps up.

concentration_points.concentration_title: Online tutoring as a side hustle
concentration_points.concentration_description: Online tutoring's status as a side hustle benefits keep the market fragmented.
Some companies bring online tutors together to help connect students to qualified teachers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: THE INDUSTRY'S RELIANCE ON PART-TIMERS KEEPS WAGES MANAGEABLE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wages remain high because of the labor-intensive nature of tutoring.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: ONLINE TUTORS USE LAPTOPS, MICROPHONES AND DIGITAL PENS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Online tutors purchase materials like textbooks and teaching guides.
Online tutoring services have other professional services and product development costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Online tutoring services looking to hire tutors can rely on tutoring session income to cover employee expenses.
Customized Online Tutoring Fits With a Student's Classroom Curriculum and Learning Habits.

volatility_points.volatility_title: The current period has been exceptionally volatile
volatility_points.volatility_description: Students' behavior, learning habits, background, motivation and soft skills help online tutors develop lesson plans.

FAQs.question: Has the demographic breakdown of your student/client base changed as the population has aged more quickly?
FAQs.answer: Nonschool-aged students comprise a small but growing share of revenue. K-12 students and college and university-level students still generate the bulk of revenue.

FAQs.question: Have you changed your offerings to adapt to changing student interests?
How has your company sought to compete with in-person tutoring services?
FAQs.answer: The digital nature of online tutoring allows companies to operate just about anywhere.

FAQs.question: How has your establishment been affected by the socioeconomic dynamics in your area?
FAQs.answer: Students in areas with higher disposable incomes are more easily able to pay for online tutoring services.

FAQs.question: What technologies have you implemented?
FAQs.answer: New technologies, like graphic tablets, allow tutors to actively solve problems on a screen.

FAQs.question: Have you increased your investment in educational technology?
FAQs.answer: Aside from hiring knowledgeable tutors, companies can differentiate themselves by offering more advanced and accessible technologies.

FAQs.question: How do changes in government funding affect your institution?
FAQs.answer: Any reduction in government funding for primary and secondary education generally benefits online tutors.

FAQs.question: Do you work with any advocacy groups to advance your establishment's interests?
FAQs.answer: Professional certifications are offered through the National Tutoring Association and the American Tutoring Association.

FAQs.question: How do your wage outlays compare to your competitors'?
FAQs.answer: Wages make up the single highest cost for the average online tutoring service.

FAQs.question: How do you deal with long gaps in the year with less funding?
FAQs.answer: Fluctuations in college enrollment and the number of K-12 students can pose threats.

FAQs.question: How do you attract and retain qualified staff? What qualifications must your staff have?
FAQs.answer: Tutoring services require skilled employees with expertise in information technology.

FAQs.question: Do you have a strong reputation among customers? Are you known for your reliability and performance?
FAQs.answer: Online tutors need a solid reputation for quality training and a proven track record.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue is derived from K-12 students? How can you adapt as this segment stagnates?
FAQs.answer: An uptick in the number of students causes revenue to rise as a greater pool of students demand help.

FAQs.question: How can you market to other age groups?
Do you monitor trends in disposable income?
FAQs.answer: A rise in per capita disposable income boosts revenue as more students can afford tutoring.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your revenue is derived from college students? Has this market expanded in recent years?
FAQs.answer: Growth in the number of college students bolsters demand for tutoring services.
